intro: Anisomeles mollissima, commonly known as the silky anisomeles, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded areas. Its botanical features make it a unique addition to both horticultural collections and ecological studies.
